meanings.definition: Repelling or failing to mix with liquids.
meanings.sent1: The lyophobic coating on the pan prevented the sauce from sticking.
meanings.sent2: The oil and water formed separate layers due to their lyophobic nature.
meanings.sent3: The lyophobic paint on the wall seemed to dodge any attempts to cover it up.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like a lyophobic force, pushing others away effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The lyophobic material was like a magnet for water, always keeping them apart.

meanings.definition: A substance that repels or fails to mix with liquids.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the lyophobic to understand its properties better.
meanings.sent2: Oil is a common lyophobic used in various industries.
meanings.sent3: The lyophobic in the experiment seemed to have a mind of its own, avoiding any contact with the liquid.
meanings.sent4: The lyophobic acted like a stubborn child, refusing to blend in with the solution.
meanings.sent5: The lyophobic substance stood out in the mixture, clearly separate from the rest.
